Stylus: An Introduction

Introduction

Stylus enables anyone to quickly and easily create engaging, self-contained modules of online content with enhanced interactivity, usability and accessibility features.

Stylus has been created and built with non-technical content authors in mind and allows anyone with basic HTML skills, or web-page editing software, to quickly create interactive online content that will work on a variety of platforms, web browsers and mobile devices. It is fully responsive ensuring your content will look great and behave as intended no matter the size of screen being used; be it desktop, laptop, tablet or smartphone.

This demonstration provides an overview of what is possible with Stylus and how it can help you to create interactive and engaging online content with ease.

Progress to the next page when you are ready by either selecting the "Next" button or swiping to the left.

Content Navigation

Stylus gives your readers a variety of ways to navigate through your multi-page content.

Content can be displayed one page at a time ("successive") or all at once ("continuous"), giving readers the ability to choose whether to focus on one page at a time or to quickly scroll back and forth between multiple pages. This will prove useful depending on whether the user is reading the content for the first time, refering back to something they've previously read or viewing the content on a touch-enabled mobile device where continuous scrolling of content is likely more comfortable and expected.

Buttons

Stylus provides unobtrusive navigation buttons at both the top and the bottom of the screen for the added comfort and convenience of your readers:

  • The " Previous" and " Next" buttons allow the reader to progress backwards and forwards through the content.
  • The " Contents" menu allows the reader to jump to a specific page.

On smaller screens, such as smartphones, the top navigation bar will change due to the amount of available space so that only the Contents button is visible at the top. The navigation buttons at the bottom of the screen remain unchanged.

By default the Previous and Next buttons at the bottom of the screen appear on the right-hand side. The " Alignment" button allows the reader to switch this to the opposite side of the screen, accomodating their individual needs or preference. This is particularly useful on mobile devices where these controls are more likely to be thumb activated and it cannot be assumed that all users are right-handed or have right-handed mobility.

Swiping

Swiping through content is also possible and is available on both touch and non-touch enabled devices:

  • Swiping left allows the reader to progress forwards through each page of content.
  • Swiping right allows the reader to progress backwards through each page of content.

Options

The "Options" menu allows the reader to customise the presentation of content in a manner that suits them best depending on their individual needs or preferences.

Page view

Changes how the pages of the document are presented to the reader.

  • Successive : View the pages of the document on a singular, successive, page-by-page basis.
  • Continuous : View the pages of the document as one, long, continuous page.
  • Enhanced : View the pages of the document with enhanced widgets.
  • Simple : View the pages of the document as simple text.
  • Duplicate : Duplicate the document in a new window. This is useful for when the content is presented within a size-restricted window or frameset; allowing you to take advantage of more screen space.
  • Reload : Reload the document in the current window. This is useful for when you want to refresh the page or correct any issues caused during the initial document loading.
  • Plain : Open a plain, simplified version of the document in a new window. This is useful for when you want to view a completely unenhanced, text-only version of the document, with no Stylus embellishments.
  • Print : Opens a print prompt so you can print a hard copy of the document.

Text view

Changes the page contrast of the document.

The reader can select a different page contrast depending on their individual needs. This is particularly useful to readers with a visual impairment or dyslexia, who may prefer a high contrast or pastel design over the default page theme.

Changes the text size of the document.

The reader can select a different text size to the default option. This is particularly useful to readers with a visual impairment or for those who find it more comfortable to read larger text on screens.

Widgets

Stylus provides a variety of widgets that can help bring greater interactivity, usability and context to your content.

All of the widgets can be added to your content with simple HTML and can be customised easily. No programming knowledge is required.

The following pages demonstrate the widgets that are currently available.

Widgets / Accordion

The accordion widget enables you to present your content within groups of expandable/collapsible panels.

This allows you to reveal content to readers in a progressive manner or to allow them to choose which content they read and in what order.

Without icons

A standard accordion contains no icons: just a simple set of headings and expandable content.

Segment C

This is the content of Segment C.

With icons

You can easily attach icons to your headings by optionally choosing to generate a thumbnail of the first image that appears within your content. Icons can be aligned left or right of the heading text.

Segment A

This is the content of Segment A.

This is the content of Segment B.

Segment C

This is the content of Segment C.

With just icons

You may only want to attach an icon to your headings, not have it appear in the content as well, in which case Stylus has you covered.

This is the content of Segment C.

With Font Awesome icons

Stylus comes with Font Awesome included, giving you easy access to over 500 scalable vector icons. Simply select the icons you want to use, add the accompanying HTML snippets to your content, and your headings will be embellished automatically.

With toggle all

Finally, you may like to present an accordion where all panels can be opened, closed or toggled with a single button.

Widgets / Audio

The audio widget enables you to present audio content with ease.

This allows you to provide embedded audio without having to concern yourself with any of the technical implementation.

file-big_buck_bunny_trailer_music

Audio can be presented as just a single file, as shown above, or as a playlist of files, as shown below.

file-big_buck_bunny_trailer_music Big Buck Bunny - Trailer Music

file-big_buck_bunny_trailer_music Big Buck Bunny - Trailer Music

Big Buck Bunny trailer music is distributed under the terms of the Creative Commons Attribution-Noncommercial-NoDerivativeWorks 3.0 license.

Stylus uses MediaElement.js to embed audio and video content.

For simplicity, Stylus anticipates that all your audio files will be in the MP3 file format (*.mp3).

Widgets / Dialog

The dialog widget enables you to present concealed content within an interactive pop-up.

This allows you to provide additional, ancillary information to the main content or perhaps reveal an activity or answer to a question that has been posed.

My Dialog

My Dialog

This is the content of my dialog. It resides within the same web page as the link that launched it.

Widgets / Feature

The feature widget enables you to highlight featured content.

This allows you to draw attention to specific content, such as activities, questions or important information.

Without heading or icon

A standard feature contains no icons: just a simple border surrounding the content.

This is an example of featured content.

Without heading, with icon

Stylus comes with Font Awesome included, giving you easy access to over 500 scalable vector icons. Simply specify the icon you want to use and your featured content will be embellished automatically. Icons can be aligned left or right of the feature.

This is an example of featured content with an icon.

This is an example of featured content with an icon.

With heading, without icon

My Featured Content

This is an example of featured content with a heading but without an icon.

With heading and icon

My Featured Content

This is an example of featured content with a heading and icon.

My Featured Content

This is an example of featured content with a heading and icon.

Widgets / Slider

The slider widget enables you to present your content within groups of sliding panels.

This allows you to present a succession of related content to readers within a single defined space.

Without caption

A standard set of slides appears without a caption and cycles through each slide automatically.

Segment A

Segment B

Segment C

With caption

You can easily add a caption by specifying that one should be present (either at the top or at the bottom of the content).

Without automatic sliding

You can specify that a slider does not cycle automatically if you wish, relying only on manual user interaction.

Without looping

You can also specify that a slider does not loop back to the start if you wish, creating a definitive start and end point to the slider.

With responsive height

You can also specify that a slider has a responsive height, automatically adjusting to fit the content contained within each slide rather than maintaining a set height across all slides.

Please note

For usability reasons, if this feature is enabled then automatic content sliding will be disabled.

Widgets / Tabs

The tabs widget enables you to present your content within groups of tabbed panels.

This allows you to reveal different, yet contextually similar, content to readers within a single defined space. Tabs can be set to appear horizontally or vertically.

Without icons

A standard set of tabs contains no icons: just a simple set of headings and tabbed content.

You can easily attach icons to your headings by optionally choosing to generate a thumbnail of the first image that appears within your content. Icons can be aligned left or right of the heading text.

Widgets / Video

The video widget enables you to present video content with ease.

This allows you to provide embedded video without having to concern yourself with any of the technical implementation.

file-big_buck_bunny Big Buck Bunny

Video can be presented as just a single file, as shown above, or as a playlist of files, as shown below.

file-big_buck_bunny Big Buck Bunny

file-elephants_dream Elephants Dream

file-big_buck_bunny Big Buck Bunny

Stylus uses MediaElement.js to embed audio and video content.

For simplicity, Stylus anticipates that all your video files will be in the MP4 file format (*.mp4).

If you wish to convert your video content to a cross-platform compatible MP4 format then you may like to consider Miro Video Converter , which is free, open-source and very easy to use.

Summary

As you can see, Stylus presents many opportunities for creating interactive, accessible and engaging online content. It is under active development and many more features will be added in due course.

Thank you for your interest and for following this online introduction.

Author: Paul Edwards

Author: Paul Edwards
